intro: Hieracium hartii, commonly known as Hart's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. It produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
